required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Perceived Health After Hospitalization for COVID-19
clinical_study.official_title: Perceived Health After Hospitalization for COVID-19

brief_summary.textblock: There are currently no precise data available on the impact of COVID-19 on the daily life of patients after hospitalization. For the moment, studies have only demonstrated a strong impact of the diagnosis on the domains of quality of life explored by the MOS-SF36 questionnaire and the PHQ-9 depression score. Concerning the impact of COVID-19 disease after conventional hospitalization, field reports indicate extremely intense fatigue and a major physical impact lasting several weeks

primary_outcome.measure: Time to PASS and CID in patients discharged from conventional hospitalization for COVID-19 disease
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 6 months

primary_outcome.measure: The value of perceived health scores in patients who achieved PASS and MCII
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 6 months

arm_group.description: Patient discharged from a conventional short-stay hospitalization unit.

study_pop.textblock: Patient with COVID-19 discharged from a conventional short-stay hospital ward.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult patient
- Patient with a diagnosis of COVID-19 confirmed by PCR and/or CT scan
- Patient hospitalized in a short stay unit (excluding intensive care and rehabilitation) for a COVID-19 infection
- Patient providing oral consent to participate in the study
- Patient able to understand and answer the questionnaires used
- Patient able to answer the questions on an electronic device and to receive requests by email and/or SMS
- Patient who has electronic equipment at home and an Internet subscription allowing him/her to answer the questionnaires online
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient under guardianship, curatorship or a measure of judicial safeguard
